EpocheRunner
EpocheRunner

Master of the Guided Local Search

First a detection if the graph is bipartite is made. If it is, then it returns the coloring with 2 colors.

Then an upper bound of the chromatic number estimation is made.  A cycle, that starts from this bound and decreases it on every step (epoche), begins.

On every step a call to the guided local search is made.

If the result in the current step has no conflicts, the cycle continues.  If the result contains conflicts, the cycle stops and returns the result from the previous step.

Functions
evaluate
uint evaluate(
const graph_access &G,
const colors &coloring
)

Counts the conflicting nodes in a coloring of a graph G.

get_colors
inline color get_colors(
const colors &coloring
)

Finds the biggest number in a coloring.

groups
colors groups(
const colors &coloring,
const uint k
)

Finds the number of nodes grouped by color in a given k-coloring.

filter
colors filter(
const graph_access &G,
const colors &coloring,
color k
)

Merges two color classes in a k-coloring of the graph G.

The resulting coloring is granted to have at most k-1 colors, if k is correct.  Otherwise the coloring will be truncated.

solve
colors solve(
const graph_access &G,
const colors &coloring
)

Applies the GLS strategy iteratively, trying yo minimize the number of the colors in a given coloring of the graph G.

The input graph and coloring are not changed.
